board package¶

board.__init__¶

Flask application factory for the analysis web interface.

board.create_app(*, test_config=None, run_analysis_fn=None, update_new_records_fn=None)[source]¶

Create and configure the Flask application.

Parameters:

  • test_config (dict | None) – Optional config dictionary applied after app creation.

  • run_analysis_fn (collections.abc.Callable | None) – Optional override for analysis service function.

  • update_new_records_fn (collections.abc.Callable | None) – Optional override for pull/load service.

Returns:

Configured Flask app instance.

Return type:

flask.Flask

board.pages¶

Route handlers for the analysis dashboard and pull/update actions.

board.pages._is_api_route()[source]¶

Check whether the current request targets JSON API endpoints.

Returns:

True for /pull-data or /update-analysis routes.

Return type:

bool

board.pages._run_analysis_service()[source]¶

Resolve and execute the configured analysis function.

Returns:

Analysis result payload.

Return type:

dict

board.pages._update_new_records_service()[source]¶

Resolve and execute the configured pull/update function.

Returns:

Pull/update status payload.

Return type:

dict

board.pages._empty_results()[source]¶

Return a zeroed analysis payload for guarded/busy template responses.

Returns:

Default analysis result map with all metrics set to zero.

Return type:

dict[str, object]

board.pages.analysis()[source]¶

Render the analysis dashboard page.

Pending status/error messages from asynchronous pull operations are consumed on this request and included in template context.

Returns:

Rendered HTML response.

Return type:

str

board.pages.analysis_pull()[source]¶

Handle pull-data requests for both browser and API clients.

Browser /pull requests are executed asynchronously and redirected back to the dashboard. API /pull-data requests are handled synchronously and return JSON status.

Returns:

Redirect/HTML response for browser routes or JSON for API routes.

Return type:

flask.Response | tuple[flask.Response, int]

board.pages.analysis_update()[source]¶

Handle analysis-refresh requests for browser and API clients.

Update requests are blocked while a pull is in progress. Browser requests render template responses; API requests return JSON statuses.

Returns:

Redirect/HTML response for browser routes or JSON for API routes.

Return type:

flask.Response | tuple[flask.Response, int]
